definitions.definition: to touch somebody with your lips as a sign of love or sexual desire or when saying hello or goodbye

examples.text: They stood in a doorway kissing *(= kissing each other)*.
Do people in Britain kiss when they meet?
Go and kiss your mother goodnight.
He bent forward to kiss her cheek.
She kissed him on both cheeks.
He lifted the trophy up and kissed it.
He bent to kiss her again.
He kissed her long and hard on the mouth.
She let him kiss her lightly on the cheek.

phrases: kiss somebody full on the lips
kiss somebody full on the mouth

definitions.definition: to gently move or touch something

examples.text: The sunlight kissed the warm stones.

definitions.definition: a way of referring to somebody talking publicly, usually for money, about a past sexual relationship with somebody famous
to be very nice to somebody in order to persuade them to help you or to give you something
to take away the pain of an injury by kissing it

examples.text: Come here and let me kiss it better.

definitions.definition: to accept that you will lose something or be unable to do something

examples.text: Well, you can kiss goodbye to your chances of promotion.

wordOrigin: Old English cyssan (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch kussen and German küssen.
